column3: Concept ACK.\n\nThere are more references to 17.10 that could be bumped?
Concept ACK\nThis will need a few more updates though. For example Ubuntu and Ubuntu 18.04 are two different items in the Windows Store, so we should link to 18.04 from here.
I had the impression that we only support windows cross builds for bionic, due to qt 5.9. So might as well remove all previous versions/workarounds?
According to @MarcoFalke's comment, removed all other distros except for Ubuntu 18.04. Also changed the Ubuntu 18.04 WSL link according to @fanquake's comment.

Thanks @ken2812221 . Instructions are looking simpler now. Was going to run through a build but VirtualBox has crashed twice while building depends using 18.04 WSL.. Will ACK once I've got a build finished.
Concept ACK. I like this as it gets rid of a lot of confusing backwards compatibility cruft.\n

TestedACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13246/commits/9d4f9421a4898f75a4c49aaefaba2868de071d79

This is a good cleanup, less workarounds.

I've done a 64 bit depends build using WSL on a clean Windows 10 VM @ https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/6916024768ec57a00f54224640ab4e4871d2a30a
![wsl](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/40425978-75011ffa-5ecc-11e8-89f2
Finally, no more need to install packages from a different version of ubuntu.
Will this stay this way? Or is this temporarily, until `1804` becomes the default
Please add that the steps in this document only apply for `18.04`. Only saying that it is recommended is not enough, as it means you'd still have to warn people against using `16.04`.
I'm not sure, it's a different app in Microsoft Store now.
There are multiple different Ubuntu "Apps" available in the Windows store, so I think this should be ok for now.
